metadata.title: CVE-2015-4516 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
Mozilla Firefox before 41.0 allows remote attackers to bypass certainECMAScript 5 (aka ES5) API protection mechanisms and modify immutableproperties, and consequently execute arbitrary JavaScript code with chromeprivileges, via a crafted web page that does not use ES5 APIs.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-4516` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 41.0+build3-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-globalmenu - 41.0+build3-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 41.0+build3-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-testsuite - 41.0+build3-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '41.0+build3-0ubuntu0.14.04.1').
